topics: View of Objects and Corresponding Data
E-R Data Model for a Banking Enterprise
Introduction to Basic Relational Operators (SELECT, PROJECT, UNION, SET DIFFERENCE, CARTESIAN PRODUCT, RENAME)
Overview of Relational Model - Algebra Operations
Introduction to Additional Relational Operators (SET INTERSECTION, NATURAL JOIN, DIVISION, ASSIGNMENT, AGGREGATE, OUTER JOIN, DELETE, INSERT, UPDATE)
Introduction to SQL Operations (AS, STRING OPERATORS, ORDER BY, SET OPERATIONS)
Overview of SQL - Derived Relations, WITH, Views, Modifications, Joins, Data Types and DDL
Introduction to SQL Operations (DELETE, INSERT, UPDATE, JOINs)
Data types in SQL, BLOB and CLOB
Overview of Relational DB Design - Functional Dependencies, BCNF & 3NF
Functional Dependencies & Closure of Functional Dependencies
Boyce-Codd Normal Form (BCNF) & Third Normal Form (3NF)
Overview of Relational DB Design - Normalization

_metadata.course_description: In this course, students will become acquainted with the fundamental concepts of database management systems during class.
learning_outcomes: Summarize the purpose of database systems
Represent and manipulate objects in database systems
Compare and contrast different types of data models and the associated languages, including E-R model, relational model and relational database model
Apply the basic design process and the purpose of E-R model
Apply the relational model and its language, relational algebra
Apply the relational database model and its language, SQL
Build databases using design process and normalization
prerequisites: CS590 (Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms) or the equivalent
